intro:
The v-btn component replaces the standard html button with a material design theme and a multitude of options. Any color helper class can be used to alter the background or text color.

Try out an interactive screencast on how Vuetify buttons work.

block.heading: Block
block.intro: block buttons extend the full available width.

depressed.heading: Depressed
depressed.intro: depressed buttons still maintain their background color, but have no box shadow.

floating.heading: Floating
floating.intro: Floating buttons are rounded and usually contain an icon.

icon.heading: Icon
icon.intro: Icons can be used for the primary content of a button. This property makes the button rounded and applies the text prop styles.

loaders.heading: Loaders
loaders.intro: Using the loading prop, you can notify a user that there is processing taking place. The default behavior is to use a v-progress-circular component but this can be customized.

outlined.heading: Outlined
outlined.intro: outlined buttons inherit their borders from the current color applied.

rounded.heading: Rounded
rounded.intro: rounded buttons behave the same as regular buttons but have rounded edges.

sizing.heading: Sizing
sizing.intro: Buttons can be given different sizing options to fit a multitude of scenarios.

text.heading: Text
text.intro: Text buttons have no box shadow and no background. Only on hover is the container for the button shown. When used with the color prop, the supplied color is applied to the button text instead of the background.

tile.heading: Tile
tile.intro: tile buttons behave the same as regular buttons but have no border radius.
